text:
e="preserve">Rajko Dujmić (7 August 1954 – 4 August 2020) was a Croatian songwriter, composer and music producer. He was best known as a member of the pop group Novi fosili. He composed the winner entry of Eurovision Song Contest 1989, "Rock me".
He was in a car crash on 29 July 2020. Dujmić died six days later, on 4 August at the hospital, aged 65.
